Download files listed in a GWOSC segment-data frame

download_segment.Rd

Download the files described by the url column of file.df and save them into a local directory. This helper is intentionally simple: it takes the url values returned by get_segment() and preserves the original file basenames when saving.

Usage

download_segment(
  file.df,
  path,
  background = FALSE,
  background.wait = 30,
  timeout = 300
)

Arguments

file.df

A data.frame as returned by get_segment() that contains a url column. The function will attempt to download each url into path.

path

Character. Directory to save downloaded files. The directory is created recursively if it does not exist.

background

Logical (default FALSE). If TRUE and the job package is available, downloads will be launched as a background job. If job is not installed the function falls back to foreground downloads with a warning.

background.wait

Integer (default 30). When using background = TRUE, the function polls for the presence of the first file every background.wait seconds and returns once the first file exists.

timeout

Integer (default 300). Download timeout in seconds; the function temporarily sets options(timeout = ...) while downloading.

Value

A character vector with full paths to the files that were (or will be) written. If background mode is used the files may still be downloading when this function returns.

See also

get_segment

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
files <- get_segment("O1", "H1", 1126051217, 1126051217 + 4096)
outpaths <- download_segment(files, path = "data/O1_H1/")
print(outpaths)
} # }
